did.abstract: This collection contains diaries, 1906-1913; correspondence; corrected manuscripts of literary works by Hermann Broch, Golo Mann, and others, 1945-1970; lecture notes on philosophy of history; contemporary politics for lectures given in Germany and the United States; and 16 audio recordings of lectures, readings, and other presentations.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Kahler Papers are not processed but a detailed ealier inventory is available for researchers who contact the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Erich Von Kahler was born on October 14, 1885 in Prague. Kahler studied at the University of Munich, the University of Berlin, the University of Heidelberg, and the University of Freiburg. Kahler eventually received his doctorate from the University of Vienna in 1911 and left Germany in 1933 because he was Jewish and deprived of his citizenship under Hitler's reign. Kahler lived in England until 1938, when he emigrated to the United States.

Kahler taught at a variety of Universities in the United States including The New School, Black Mountain College, Cornell University, and Princeton University. Kahler was a member of the Institute for Advanced Study and wrote many books on politics, technology, and science. Kahler was married to Josephine Sobotka, and later to Alice (Lili) Loewy. Kahler died on June 28, 1970, in Princeton, New Jersey and was survived by his wife and stepdaughter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Erich von Kahler was a German-American literary scholar and teacher. Kahler taught at the New School for Social Research, at Cornell University and Princeton University. This collection contains diaries, 1906-1913, correspondence in German and English with Hans Bethe, Richard BeerHofmann, Jacob Bronowski, Albert Einstein, Elizabeth Mann Borgese, Erich Fromm, Herbert Marcuse, J. Robert Oppenheimer, Kurt Wolff, and others, 1923-1970. This collection also includes corrected manuscripts of literary works by Hermann Broch, Golo Mann, and others, 1945-1970, lecture notes on philosophy of history, Jewish history, German literature, and contemporary politics for lectures given in Germany and the United States and for courses at Black Mountain College and Ohio State University, 1915-1968, and 16 audio recordings of lectures, readings, and other presentations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Archivists previously arranged the collection into nine general series.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This majority of the collection was donated by Alice Loewy Kahler in the late 1970s with a small amount of material donated by Janit Roberts in 1991.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is not fully processed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives
